DOC.brief_summary: R2C2 study has shown that abdominal obesity is associated with a cardiac and vascular remodelling in healthy volunteers. This remodelling is correlated with renin-angiotensin aldosterone system (RAAS) activation and/or systemic fibrosis. R2C2 II study is designed to confirm the hypothesis that RAAS is associated with an early remodelling and implicated in the transition to cardiac failure in abdominal obesity.
DOC.brief_title: Role of the Renin Angiotensin Aldosterone System in the Mechanisms of Transition to Heart Failure in Abdominal Obesity
DOC.detailed_description: Follow up of abdominal obesity patients from the R2C2 cohort study.
DOC.criteria: Being a former member of R2C2 study, abdominal obese group. Having signed the informed consent (refusing to participate to the genetic study is not an exclusion criteria). being affiliated to health insurance scheme.
